pe_description: The Nondurable Household Products sub-sector in Indonesia exhibits a P/E ratio of 1.8, indicating that it is currently undervalued compared to the average IDX P/E ratio. This sub-sector has outperformed its P/E ratio from the previous year and ranks first among other sub-sectors in the Indonesian market. However, it is important to note that only three companies, '###Mustika Ratu Tbk####', '###PT Uni-Charm Indonesia Tbk.####', and '###Unilever Indonesia Tbk####', are considered undervalued based on their P/E ratios, while '###PT Victoria Care Indonesia Tbk####' is considered overvalued and should be avoided. Factors that could influence growth within this sub-sector include consumer spending patterns, economic conditions, and industry trends.
health_description: The Nondurable Household Products sub-sector's performance in the last 30 days has been below average compared to the overall IDX, with only 3 out of 12 companies showing positive price changes. This sub-sector's resilience and health index can be affected by factors such as consumer spending patterns, changes in disposable income, government regulations, and competition from other sub-sectors. The Indonesian government body responsible for regulating this sub-sector is the Ministry of Industry.
growth_description: The Nondurable Household Products sub-sector in Indonesia has experienced significant growth in the past year, with an average YoY quarter earnings change of 22.97% and an average YoY quarter revenue change of 2.3%. This sub-sector ranks 17th in terms of earnings and 24th in terms of revenue compared to other sub-sectors. Within the sub-sector, ###Martina Berto Tbk####, ###PT Victoria Care Indonesia Tbk####, and ###Mustika Ratu Tbk#### are noteworthy companies with the highest YoY earning growth, YoY revenue growth, and net profit margin, respectively. However, the growth of the Nondurable Household Products sub-sector can be affected by various conditions specific to the sub-sector, such as changes in consumer preferences, shifts in market trends, and regulatory changes related to product safety and environmental standards.
